title: Kieron Gillen: Three (Image|2013|Dgtl-HR|Minutemen-InnerDemons)
description:
" There's one anecdote I found in my research which seemed telling - of Persians
   inspecting the dead at Thermopylae, encouraged they'd killed so many Free Greeks.
   Herodotus uses it to show Persian credulity - because they didn't realize that
   the fallen included many Helot[ slaves]. However, this is the only place where
   the Helot deaths were mentioned.

   We would never have known they were there if they weren't the punchline. " 


  --  from the Author's Notes



Overview:


  <a href=" http://imagecomics.com/content/view/slaves-of-ancient-sparta-rebel-in-three" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://imagecomics.com/content/view/slaves-of-ancient-sparta-rebel-in-three</a>



Contains:


   Three (2013) (Digital-HR) (Minutemen-InnerDemons)


    ( Compiled from the single-issue releases. No actual variants were ever created,
      so the cover gallery is very basic, but I managed to dig up a terrific piece
      of pre-release promotional artwork and re-purposed it as a collection cover. )
